question: Specialize access routes/interfaces to allow capturing or specification of variable values.
Firewalls restrict access based on message source or destination port.
Limit possible options: Reduce the possible options for variations for modules.
Spare: A standby spare configured to replace many different failed components.
Polymorphism: Late binding of method calls.
Bound execution times: Place a limit on how much execution time is used to respond to an event.
Maintain existing interfaces: Avoid to change interfaces that other modules uses.
Exceptions: Recognizing faults by raising exceptions when a specified fault occurs.
Increase available resources: Faster and more processors, more memory, faster network.
Shadow operation to mimic the behavior of the working components before restoring service.
Maintain a model of the task: Used to determine context of a system.
State resynchronization to upgrade a component to restore its previous state.
Configuration files: Intended to set parameters at startup.
Authorize users to ensure authenticated users have the rights to access/modify data or services
Scheduling policy: Scheduling of resources based on priority assignment and dispatching.
Checkpoint/rollback: A recording of a consistent state that can later be restored.
Hide information: Make parts of information of a module private and provide interfaces.
Authenticate users: Ensuring that a user or remote computer is actually who it claims to be.
Removal from service to undergo some activities to prevent anticipated failures.
Control frequency of sampling for queued requests possibly resulting in loss of requests.
Maintain a model of the system: Determines the expected system behavior enabling feedback.
Maintain integrity using checksums or hash results to allow testing of manipulation of the data
Heartbeat:Component emits a heartbeat message periodically and another component listens for it
Restrict communication paths: Restrict the modules with which a given module shares data.
Adherence to defined protocols: Allows runtime binding of independent processes.
Increase computational efficiency to improve algorithm or use cache methods for processor/disk
Ping/echo: Component issues a ping and expects to receive back an echo, within predefined time.
